claim: Alec Baldwin has more children than Clint Eastwood.

supporting.text: Alec Baldwin has seven children, while Clint Eastwood has eight children, making the claim false.

attacks.text: Alec Baldwin has seven children, while Clint Eastwood has eight children, making the claim false.
Alec Baldwin has eight children, including one from a recent adoption, which was not widely reported.
The adoption mentioned in B1 is not legally finalized and thus should not be counted as a child.
Clint Eastwood's eighth child is from a disputed paternity case and may not be biologically his.
The paternity test for Clint Eastwood's disputed child confirmed he is the biological father.

supporting.text: Public records show Alec Baldwin has seven children, whereas Clint Eastwood has eight, disproving the claim.

attacks.text: Public records show Alec Baldwin has seven children, whereas Clint Eastwood has eight, disproving the claim.
Public records may not account for all biological or legally recognized children, especially in cases of adoption or undisclosed relationships.
Reputable sources like birth registries and legal documents are highly reliable for verifying the number of children, making exceptions statistically negligible.
The claim could refer to publicly known or acknowledged children, where Baldwin's seven are more visible than Eastwood's eight in media coverage.
Media visibility is subjective and irrelevant to factual counts; legal or official records are the definitive measure.

supporting.text: Clint Eastwood's eight children are well-documented, exceeding Alec Baldwin's seven, contradicting the claim.

attacks.text: Clint Eastwood's eight children are well-documented, exceeding Alec Baldwin's seven, contradicting the claim.
Alec Baldwin has publicly acknowledged an additional child, bringing his total to eight, matching Clint Eastwood.
The additional child Alec Baldwin acknowledged is not biologically his, so it should not be counted in this comparison.
Parental relationships are not solely biological; acknowledged and supported children should be counted regardless of biology.
Clint Eastwood may have undisclosed children, which would further increase his count beyond eight.

supporting.text: Biographical sources confirm Clint Eastwood has fathered more children than Alec Baldwin, invalidating the claim.

attacks.text: Biographical sources confirm Clint Eastwood has fathered more children than Alec Baldwin, invalidating the claim.
Some biographical sources may be outdated or incomplete, potentially missing some of Alec Baldwin's children.
Reputable sources like official birth records and public statements confirm the accuracy of the biographical data on both actors.
The definition of 'children' could include stepchildren or informally adopted children, which might not be consistently reported.
Standard biographical reporting focuses on biological and legally recognized children, which are reliably documented for public figures.
